title: Rotational inertia - parallel axes through object

content.question: The symmetrical object shown in the figure is made of a material with uniform density and the object has mass <math alttext="5 kilograms" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>5</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>kg</mtext></math> and length <math alttext="4.0 meters" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mn>4.0</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>m</mtext></mstyle></math>. The object has rotational inertia <math alttext="10 kilogram meters squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mn>10</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>kg</mtext><mo>⋅</mo><msup><mtext>m</mtext><mn>2</mn></msup></mstyle></math> about a vertical axis through its center of mass, which is indicated by the solid line in the figure. What would the rotational inertia of the object be about a vertical axis at the right edge of the object, as indicated by the dashed line in the figure?

choices.label: <math alttext="20 kilogram meters squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mn>20</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>kg</mtext><mo>⋅</mo><msup><mtext>m</mtext><mn>2</mn></msup></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="27 kilogram meters squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mn>27</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>kg</mtext><mo>⋅</mo><msup><mtext>m</mtext><mn>2</mn></msup></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="30 kilogram meters squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mn>30</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>kg</mtext><mo>⋅</mo><msup><mtext>m</mtext><mn>2</mn></msup></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="90 kilogram meters squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mn>90</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>kg</mtext><mo>⋅</mo><msup><mtext>m</mtext><mn>2</mn></msup></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="30 kilogram meters squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mn>30</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>kg</mtext><mo>⋅</mo><msup><mtext>m</mtext><mn>2</mn></msup></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
